result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Graham Z Berger was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Graham Z Berger was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No violent contact with Jason Berger, Jamie Scholl and Jesse Scholl.
Domestic violence counseling if deemed appropriate.
Anger Management counseling if deemed appropriate.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Not to operate a MV unless properly licensed.

timeConds.notes: To help offset fines/costs at a rate of $10.00 per hour. Perform as a condition of probation.

supervisions.notes: BAIL APPLIED OF $950.00. Remaining balance to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 4/01/2015; alternate 40 days jail.
BAIL APPLIED. Blood costs PAID IN FULL. To be forwarded to the Waukesha County Sheriff's dept. DNA to be paid along with fine on payment plan.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attend Victim Impact Panel on 11/18/2015 or 20 days jail consecutive.
Perform 100 hours at a rate of $10.00 an hour to help offset fine/costs.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Graham Z Berger in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 & 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Count #3 dismissed and read in.  Count #4 dismissed by operation of law.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:

Count #1
Imposted and stayed sentence of:
JAIL:     9 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME    
TERM OF PROBATION: 1 YEAR(concurrent to 14CM2357)

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON / EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia.
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform 		Agent of all Rx..
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No (violent) contact with:Jason Berger, Jamie Scholl & Jesse Scholl
____Domestic Violence Counseling if deemed appropriate by agent;
____Anger Management if deemed appropriate by agent,
____Attend Victim Impact Panel November 18, 2015;
____DNA sample and surcharge
____ Community Service 100 hours at $10.00 per hour to offset costs/fines
____ No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation/extended supervision)

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00


Count #2
FINE: $3014.00 (apply cash bail)  Balance to be paid at $100.00 a month commencing April 1, 2016, (Defendant to serve 40 days jail as a penalty for failure to pay)
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00
Blood Draw Fee:  $35.00 to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department
DL Revocation: 36 MONTHS;
IID: 36 MONTHS;
JAIL: 270 DAYS WITH HUBER, COMMENCING FORTHWITH.
Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
